content.description: Sit start on the far leftside of the boulder with a jug for the left hand and a pocket-like jug for the right. Make a big move to the butter tub or use an intermediate, match then head up the tall face using some interesting holds before encountering an exciting topout.
content.location: On the obvious boulder. The start is basically in the water, or it is depending on water level. Starting on the butter tub hold is likely the same grade, but the intro is awesome.

content.description:
This climb avoids the far left start and unfortunately the butter tub hold itself, but it utilizes another large tub-like hold out right. This climb is fun but not as skin friendly and as juggy as the other two.

 Sit start with a sloping sidepull edge for the right and a crimp for the left. Pull up to an edge then smack a bucket and continue to the top with a slot and a big move to the sloping lip.
content.location: Directly under the topout, or slightly right.

content.description:
Maybe slightly easier than the tub itself, but more of a no fall zone.

 Sit start on the left side of the face with a low lefthand jug and a juggy pocket (Same as for "Butter Tub Factory"). Climb straight up the arete using large sidepulls up to the top. There may be one jug that may not be as solid in quality as the rest, but you can reach past this one or put less weight on it. The topout is slightly easier entering it from the side rather than out right. The landing is worse and a fall would put you directly into the rocky stream.
content.location: Left side of the boulder. Climb the left arete.

content.description: A good sized boulder with a handful of problems that climb above the water with a fun and slightly difficult topout.
